Linking to GEOS 3.13.1, GDAL 3.11.0, PROJ 9.6.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE




Getting data from the 2016-2020 5-year ACS


Warning: • You have not set a Census API key. Users without a key are limited to 500
queries per day and may experience performance limitations.
ℹ For best results, get a Census API key at
http://api.census.gov/data/key_signup.html and then supply the key to the
`census_api_key()` function to use it throughout your tidycensus session.
This warning is displayed once per session.

title: income inequality
text:
Description
The image presents a horizontal bar chart titled “Top 20 Counties by Income Inequality (Gini Index)”, based on data from the American Community Survey (ACS) 2020. It visualizes the counties in the United States with the highest levels of income inequality, as measured by the Gini Index. The Gini Index values range approximately from 0.55 to over 0.66, with higher values indicating greater inequality. Harding County, New Mexico ranks highest, followed closely by East Carroll Parish, Louisiana and Humphreys County, Mississippi. The source of the data is clearly cited in the caption at the bottom right: “Data Source: ACS 2020”. This chart effectively highlights geographic areas in the U.S. with the most pronounced income disparities.
